skill.name: managing-task-lifecycle
skill.description: Use when starting, pausing, completing, or transitioning task status in the development workflow.
skill.summary: Use when starting, pausing, completing, or transitioning task status in the development workflow.
skill.author: BPSAI

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation and workflow guide skill with minimal helper scripts. The Python scripts run standard development tools (pytest, ruff, git) with hardcoded arguments for task validation. No network access, no credential handling, and no dynamic command construction. The static scanner flagged documentation examples and YAML frontmatter, but these are false positives. All external commands are trusted dev tools with static arguments.

low_findings.title: External command execution in validation scripts
low_findings.description: check_completion.py runs pytest, ruff, and git as external processes. These are standard dev tools executed with hardcoded arguments for testing and linting verification.

content.user_title: Manage task lifecycle with enforcement gates
content.value_statement: Managing task transitions is complex and error-prone. Without enforcement gates, acceptance criteria get skipped and tasks are marked complete prematurely. This skill provides a structured workflow with automated verification for starting, tracking, and completing tasks with Trello synchronization.
actual_capabilities: Start tasks with automatic state updates and Trello card movement
Complete tasks with strict acceptance criteria verification
Block tasks with documented reasons and state synchronization
Track progress with comments and milestone updates
Validate task completion with tests, linting, and git checks
Synchronize task state with Trello boards automatically
limitations: Requires PairCoder CLI (bpsai-pair) for full functionality
Trello features need API credentials configured separately
Works only with PairCoder project structure and task file format
External tool dependencies (pytest, ruff) must be installed

use_cases.title: Manage sprint tasks
use_cases.description: Track individual task progress through the full development cycle with automated enforcement gates.

use_cases.title: Sync with Trello
use_cases.description: Keep Trello boards synchronized with local task state for team visibility and reporting.

use_cases.title: Enforce completion criteria
use_cases.description: Verify all acceptance criteria are met before allowing tasks to be marked as complete.

prompt_templates.title: Start a task
prompt_templates.prompt: Start working on task T28.1. Check the budget first and then update the task status to in_progress. Show me the acceptance criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Track progress
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a progress comment to Trello card TRELLO-abc123 saying I completed the API endpoints and am starting tests.

prompt_templates.title: Check completion readiness
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if task T28.1 is ready for completion. Run the completion checklist to verify tests pass, linting is clean, and all acceptance criteria are checked.

prompt_templates.title: Complete with verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Complete task TRELLO-abc123 with strict mode enabled. Use the summary: 'Implemented user authentication with JWT tokens. All tests passing.'

output_examples.input: Start working on T28.1 and show me the acceptance criteria
output: Task T28.1 status updated to in_progress
Trello card moved to In Progress
Implement user model with email and password fields
Create login endpoint with JWT authentication
Write unit tests for authentication module

output_examples.input: Check if my task is ready for completion
output: Task file: Valid format with all required fields
Ready for completion! Run: bpsai-pair ttask done TRELLO-XX --summary '...' --list 'Deployed/Done'

best_practices: Always run budget check before starting to avoid overspending on tasks
Use strict mode (--strict) for ttask done to enforce acceptance criteria verification
Update state.md after every task completion to maintain project context
anti_patterns: Using task update --status done directly on Trello projects instead of ttask done
Skipping strict mode and bypassing acceptance criteria checks

faq.question: Which tools are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Claude Code and Claude. Requires PairCoder CLI installed. Codex support is limited to prompt templates only.

faq.question: What are the task ID formats?
faq.answer: Three formats: T28.1 (sprint tasks), TASK-150 (legacy), TRELLO-abc123 (Trello cards). Use matching commands for each.

faq.question: How does Trello integration work?
faq.answer: Configure credentials via bpsai-pair trello connect. Cards sync automatically on task start, update, block, and complete.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill reads only local task files and runs dev tools locally. No data is sent externally. Trello API calls use your credentials.

faq.question: Why is my task blocked from completion?
faq.answer: Strict mode requires all acceptance criteria checked, tests passing, and linting clean. Run check_completion.py to see what is failing.

faq.question: How is this different from other task tools?
faq.answer: This skill enforces workflow gates and syncs with Trello. Unlike basic task managers, it requires acceptance criteria verification before completion.
